intro: Trachymene koebrensis, commonly known as the Koebrensis green gentian, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often found in swampy areas or along watercourses, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat. Trachymene koebrensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
